rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ACDCTerminal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An electrical connection point (AC or DC) to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BusNameMarker
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The bus name marker used to name the bus (topological node).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: connected
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The connected status is related to a bus-branch model and the topological node to terminal relation. True implies the terminal is connected to the related topological node and false implies it is not. In a bus-branch model, the connected status is used to tell if equipment is disconnected without having to change the connectivity described by the topological node to terminal relation. A valid case is that conducting equipment can be connected in one end and open in the other. In particular for an AC line segment, where the reactive line charging can be significant, this is a relevant case.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sequenceNumber
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The orientation of the terminal connections for a multiple terminal conducting equipment. The sequence numbering starts with 1 and additional terminals should follow in increasing order. The first terminal is the "starting point" for a two terminal branch.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ACLineSegment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system. For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment. Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances. The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Clamp
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The clamps connected to the line segment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Cut
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Cuts applied to the line segment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AsynchronousMachine
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A rotating machine whose shaft rotates asynchronously with the electrical field. Also known as an induction machine with no external connection to the rotor windings, e.g. squirrel-cage induction machine.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BaseVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Defines a system base voltage which is referenced.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConductingEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All conducting equipment with this base voltage. Use only when there is no voltage level container used and only one base voltage applies. For example, not used for transformers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnds
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer ends at the base voltage. This is essential for PU calculation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VoltageLevel
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The voltage levels having this base voltage.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: nominalVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The power system resource's base voltage. Shall be a positive value and not zero.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Bay
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A collection of power system resources (within a given substation) including conducting equipment, protection relays, measurements, and telemetry. A bay typically represents a physical grouping related to modularization of equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Substation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Substation containing the bay.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VoltageLevel
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The voltage level containing this bay.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Breaker
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A mechanical switching device capable of making, carrying, and breaking currents under normal circuit conditions and also making, carrying for a specified time, and breaking currents under specified abnormal circuit conditions e.g. those of short circuit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BusNameMarker
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Used to apply user standard names to TopologicalNodes. Associated with one or more terminals that are normally connected with the bus name. The associated terminals are normally connected by non-retained switches. For a ring bus station configuration, all BusbarSection terminals in the ring are typically associated. For a breaker and a half scheme, both BusbarSections would normally be associated. For a ring bus, all BusbarSections would normally be associated. For a "straight" busbar configuration, normally only the main terminal at the BusbarSection would be associated.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Terminal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The terminals associated with this bus name marker.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: priority
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Priority of bus name marker for use as topology bus name. Use 0 for do not care. Use 1 for highest priority. Use 2 as priority is less than 1 and so on.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BusbarSection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation. Voltage measurements are typically obtained from voltage transformers that are connected to busbar sections. A bus bar section may have many physical terminals but for analysis is modelled with exactly one logical terminal.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Clamp
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Clamp is a galvanic connection at a line segment where other equipment is connected. A Clamp does not cut the line segment. A Clamp is ConductingEquipment and has one Terminal with an associated ConnectivityNode. Any other ConductingEquipment can be connected to the Clamp ConnectivityNode.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConductingEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BaseVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Base voltage of this conducting equipment. Use only when there is no voltage level container used and only one base voltage applies. For example, not used for transformers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Terminals
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Conducting equipment have terminals that may be connected to other conducting equipment terminals via connectivity nodes or topological nodes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Conductor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Combination of conducting material with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry current between points in the power system.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: length
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Segment length for calculating line section capabilities.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConformLoad
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: ConformLoad represent loads that follow a daily load change pattern where the pattern can be used to scale the load with a system load.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConnectivityNode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Connectivity nodes are points where terminals of AC conducting equipment are connected together with zero impedance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConnectivityNodeContainer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Container of this connectivity node.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Terminals
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Terminals interconnected with zero impedance at a this connectivity node.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConnectivityNodeContainer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A base class for all objects that may contain connectivity nodes or topological nodes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConnectivityNodes
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Connectivity nodes which belong to this connectivity node container.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Connector
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation and are modelled with a single logical terminal.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Cut
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A cut separates a line segment into two parts. The cut appears as a switch inserted between these two parts and connects them together. As the cut is normally open there is no galvanic connection between the two line segment parts. But it is possible to close the cut to get galvanic connection. The cut terminals are oriented towards the line segment terminals with the same sequence number. Hence the cut terminal with sequence number equal to 1 is oriented to the line segment's terminal with sequence number equal to 1. The cut terminals also act as connection points for jumpers and other equipment, e.g. a mobile generator. To enable this, connectivity nodes are placed at the cut terminals. Once the connectivity nodes are in place any conducting equipment can be connected at them.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ACLineSegment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The line segment to which the cut is applied.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: DisconnectingCircuitBreaker
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A circuit breaking device including disconnecting function, eliminating the need for separate disconnectors.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Disconnector
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A manually operated or motor operated mechanical switching device used for changing the connections in a circuit, or for isolating a circuit or equipment from a source of power. It is required to open or close circuits when negligible current is broken or made.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EarthFaultCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A conducting equipment used to represent a connection to ground which is typically used to compensate earth faults. An earth fault compensator device modelled with a single terminal implies a second terminal solidly connected to ground. If two terminals are modelled, the ground is not assumed and normal connection rules apply.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergyConnection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A connection of energy generation or consumption on the power system model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergyConsumer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Generic user of energy - a point of consumption on the power system model. EnergyConsumer.pfixed, .qfixed, .pfixedPct and .qfixedPct have meaning only if there is no LoadResponseCharacteristic associated with EnergyConsumer or if LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is set to False.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanical.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EquipmentContainer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Container of this equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: inService
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: networkAnalysisEnabled
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis. If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: normallyInService
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EquipmentContainer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A modelling construct to provide a root class for containing equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipments
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contained equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EquivalentEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The class represents equivalent objects that are the result of a network reduction. The class is the base for equivalent objects of different types.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EquivalentInjection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class represents equivalent injections (generation or load). Voltage regulation is allowed only at the point of connection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: IdentifiedObject
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This is a root class to provide common identification for all classes needing identification and naming attributes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Names
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All names of this identified object.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: aliasName
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy. The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: description
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mRID
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Jumper
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A short section of conductor with negligible impedance which can be manually removed and replaced if the circuit is de-energized. Note that zero-impedance branches can potentially be modelled by other equipment types.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Junction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A point where one or more conducting equipments are connected with zero resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Length
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Unit of length. It shall be a positive value or zero.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Line
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contains equipment beyond a substation belonging to a power transmission line.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: LinearShuntCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A linear shunt compensator has banks or sections with equal admittance values.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Name class provides the means to define any number of human readable names for an object. A name is not to be used for defining inter-object relationships. For inter-object relationships instead use the object identification 'mRID'.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: IdentifiedObject
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Identified object that this name designates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NameType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Type of this name.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Any free text that name the object.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NameType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Type of name. Possible values for attribute 'name' are implementation dependent but standard profiles may specify types. An enterprise may have multiple IT systems each having its own local name for the same object, e.g. a planning system may have different names from an EMS. An object may also have different names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14. The definition from CIM14 is: The localName is a human readable name of the object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation, VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have names that typically are unique among them.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NameTypeAuthority
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Authority responsible for managing names of this type.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Names
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All names of this type.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: description
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Description of the name type.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of the name type.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NameTypeAuthority
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Authority responsible for creation and management of names of a given type; typically an organization or an enterprise system.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NameTypes
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All name types managed by this authority.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: description
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Description of the name type authority.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of the name type authority.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NonConformLoad
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: NonConformLoad represents loads that do not follow a daily load change pattern and whose changes are not correlated with the daily load change pattern.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NonlinearShuntCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A non linear shunt compensator has bank or section admittance values that differ. The attributes g, b, g0 and b0 of the associated NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint describe the total conductance and admittance of a NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint at a section number specified by NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint.sectionNumber.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseCode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An unordered enumeration of phase identifiers. Allows designation of phases for both transmission and distribution equipment, circuits and loads. The enumeration, by itself, does not describe how the phases are connected together or connected to ground. Ground is not explicitly denoted as a phase. Residential and small commercial loads are often served from single-phase, or split-phase, secondary circuits. For the example of s12N, phases 1 and 2 refer to hot wires that are 180 degrees out of phase, while N refers to the neutral wire. Through single-phase transformer connections, these secondary circuits may be served from one or two of the primary phases A, B, and C. For three-phase loads, use the A, B, C phase codes instead of s12N. The integer values are from IEC 61968-9 to support revenue metering applications.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase A.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AB
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phases A and B.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ABC
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phases A, B, and C.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ABCN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phases A, B, C, and N.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ABN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phases A, B, and neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AC
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phases A and C.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ACN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phases A, C and neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phases A and neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: B
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase B.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BC
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phases B and C.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BCN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phases B, C, and neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phases B and neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: C
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase C.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phases C and neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: N
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Neutral phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: X
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Unknown non-neutral phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: XN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Unknown non-neutral phase plus neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: XY
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Two unknown non-neutral phases.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: XYN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Two unknown non-neutral phases plus neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: none
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: No phases specified.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: s1
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Secondary phase 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: s12
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Secondary phase 1 and 2.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: s12N
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Secondary phases 1, 2, and neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: s1N
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Secondary phase 1 and neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: s2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Secondary phase 2.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: s2N
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Secondary phase 2 and neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A power system resource (PSR) can be an item of equipment such as a switch, an equipment container containing many individual items of equipment such as a substation, or an organisational entity such as sub-control area. Power system resources can have measurements associated.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An electrical device consisting of two or more coupled windings, with or without a magnetic core, for introducing mutual coupling between electric circuits. Transformers can be used to control voltage and phase shift (active power flow). A power transformer may be composed of separate transformer tanks that need not be identical. A power transformer can be modelled with or without tanks and is intended for use in both balanced and unbalanced representations. A power transformer typically has two terminals, but may have one (grounding), three or more terminals. The inherited association ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage should not be used. The association from TransformerEnd to BaseVoltage should be used instead.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The ends of this power transformer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A PowerTransformerEnd is associated with each Terminal of a PowerTransformer. The impedance values r, r0, x, and x0 of a PowerTransformerEnd represents a star equivalent as follows. 1) for a two Terminal PowerTransformer the high voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=1) PowerTransformerEnd has non zero values on r, r0, x, and x0 while the low voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=2) PowerTransformerEnd has zero values for r, r0, x, and x0. Parameters are always provided, even if the PowerTransformerEnds have the same rated voltage. In this case, the parameters are provided at the PowerTransformerEnd which has TransformerEnd.endNumber equal to 1. 2) for a three Terminal PowerTransformer the three PowerTransformerEnds represent a star equivalent with each leg in the star represented by r, r0, x, and x0 values. 3) For a three Terminal transformer each PowerTransformerEnd shall have g, g0, b and b0 values corresponding to the no load losses distributed on the three PowerTransformerEnds. The total no load loss shunt impedances may also be placed at one of the PowerTransformerEnds, preferably the end numbered 1, having the shunt values on end 1. This is the preferred way. 4) for a PowerTransformer with more than three Terminals the PowerTransformerEnd impedance values cannot be used. Instead use the TransformerMeshImpedance or split the transformer into multiple PowerTransformers. Each PowerTransformerEnd must be contained by a PowerTransformer. Because a PowerTransformerEnd (or any other object) can not be contained by more than one parent, a PowerTransformerEnd can not have an association to an EquipmentContainer (Substation, VoltageLevel, etc).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The power transformer of this power transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ProtectedSwitch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A ProtectedSwitch is a switching device that can be operated by ProtectionEquipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Recloser
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pole-mounted fault interrupter with built-in phase and ground relays, current transformer (CT), and supplemental controls.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RegulatingCondEq
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A type of conducting equipment that can regulate a quantity (i.e. voltage or flow) at a specific point in the network.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RotatingMachine
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A rotating machine which may be used as a generator or motor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SeriesCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Series Compensator is a series capacitor or reactor or an AC transmission line without charging susceptance. It is a two terminal device.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ShuntCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A shunt capacitor or reactor or switchable bank of shunt capacitors or reactors. A section of a shunt compensator is an individual capacitor or reactor. A negative value for bPerSection indicates that the compensator is a reactor. ShuntCompensator is a single terminal device. Ground is implied.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: StaticVarCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
A facility for providing variable and controllable shunt reactive power. The SVC typically consists of a stepdown transformer, filter, thyristor-controlled reactor, and thyristor-switched capacitor arms.
The SVC may operate in fixed MVar output mode or in voltage control mode. When in voltage control mode, the output of the SVC will be proportional to the deviation of voltage at the controlled bus from the voltage setpoint. The SVC characteristic slope defines the proportion. If the voltage at the controlled bus is equal to the voltage setpoint, the SVC MVar output is zero.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: StationSupply
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Station supply with load derived from the station output.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Substation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A collection of equipment for purposes other than generation or utilization, through which electric energy in bulk is passed for the purposes of switching or modifying its characteristics.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Bays
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Bays contained in the substation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VoltageLevels
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The voltage levels within this substation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Switch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A generic device designed to close, or open, or both, one or more electric circuits. All switches are two terminal devices including grounding switches. The ACDCTerminal.connected at the two sides of the switch shall not be considered for assessing switch connectivity, i.e. only Switch.open, .normalOpen and .locked are relevant.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: locked
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
If true, the switch is locked. The resulting switch state is a combination of locked and Switch.open attributes as follows:
  • locked=true and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open and locked;
  • locked=false and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open;
  • locked=false and Switch.open=false. The resulting state is closed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: normalOpen
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The attribute is used in cases when no Measurement for the status value is present. If the Switch has a status measurement the Discrete.normalValue is expected to match with the Switch.normalOpen.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: open
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The attribute tells if the switch is considered open when used as input to topology processing.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: retained
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Branch is retained in the topological solution. The flow through retained switches will normally be calculated in power flow.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SynchronousMachine
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An electromechanical device that operates with shaft rotating synchronously with the network. It is a single machine operating either as a generator or synchronous condenser or pump.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Terminal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConductingEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The conducting equipment of the terminal. Conducting equipment have terminals that may be connected to other conducting equipment terminals via connectivity nodes or topological nodes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConnectivityNode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The connectivity node to which this terminal connects with zero impedance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All transformer ends connected at this terminal.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phases
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Represents the normal network phasing condition. If the attribute is missing, three phases (ABC) shall be assumed, except for terminals of grounding classes (specializations of EarthFaultCompensator, GroundDisconnector, and Ground) which will be assumed to be N. Therefore, phase code ABCN is explicitly declared when needed, e.g. for star point grounding equipment. The phase code on terminals connecting same ConnectivityNode or same TopologicalNode as well as for equipment between two terminals shall be consistent.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A conducting connection point of a power transformer. It corresponds to a physical transformer winding terminal. In earlier CIM versions, the TransformerWinding class served a similar purpose, but this class is more flexible because it associates to terminal but is not a specialization of ConductingEquipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Terminal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Terminal of the power transformer to which this transformer end belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: UnitMultiplier
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
The unit multipliers defined for the CIM. When applied to unit symbols, the unit symbol is treated as a derived unit. Regardless of the contents of the unit symbol text, the unit symbol shall be treated as if it were a single-character unit symbol. Unit symbols should not contain multipliers, and it should be left to the multiplier to define the multiple for an entire data type.
For example, if a unit symbol is "m2Pers" and the multiplier is "k", then the value is k(m**2/s), and the multiplier applies to the entire final value, not to any individual part of the value. This can be conceptualized by substituting a derived unit symbol for the unit type. If one imagines that the symbol "" represents the derived unit "m2Pers", then applying the multiplier "k" can be conceptualized simply as "k".
For example, the SI unit for mass is "kg" and not "g". If the unit symbol is defined as "kg", then the multiplier is applied to "kg" as a whole and does not replace the "k" in front of the "g". In this case, the multiplier of "m" would be used with the unit symbol of "kg" to represent one gram. As a text string, this violates the instructions in IEC 80000-1. However, because the unit symbol in CIM is treated as a derived unit instead of as an SI unit, it makes more sense to conceptualize the "kg" as if it were replaced by one of the proposed replacements for the SI mass symbol. If one imagines that the "kg" were replaced by a symbol "", then it is easier to conceptualize the multiplier "m" as creating the proper unit "m", and not the forbidden unit "mkg".

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: G
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Giga 10**9.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: M
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mega 10**6.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Y
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Yotta 10**24.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Z
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zetta 10**21.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: c
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Centi 10**-2.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: da
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Deca 10**1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: h
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Hecto 10**2.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: k
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Kilo 10**3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Milli 10**-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: micro
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Micro 10**-6.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: none
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: No multiplier or equivalently multiply by 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: UnitSymbol
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The derived units defined for usage in the CIM. In some cases, the derived unit is equal to an SI unit. Whenever possible, the standard derived symbol is used instead of the formula for the derived unit. For example, the unit symbol Farad is defined as "F" instead of "CPerV". In cases where a standard symbol does not exist for a derived unit, the formula for the unit is used as the unit symbol. For example, density does not have a standard symbol and so it is represented as "kgPerm3". With the exception of the "kg", which is an SI unit, the unit symbols do not contain multipliers and therefore represent the base derived unit to which a multiplier can be applied as a whole. Every unit symbol is treated as an unparseable text as if it were a single-letter symbol. The meaning of each unit symbol is defined by the accompanying descriptive text and not by the text contents of the unit symbol. To allow the widest possible range of serializations without requiring special character handling, several substitutions are made which deviate from the format described in IEC 80000-1. The division symbol "/" is replaced by the letters "Per". Exponents are written in plain text after the unit as "m3" instead of being formatted as "m" with a superscript of 3 or introducing a symbol as in "m^3". The degree symbol "" is replaced with the letters "deg". Any clarification of the meaning for a substitution is included in the description for the unit symbol. Non-SI units are included in list of unit symbols to allow sources of data to be correctly labelled with their non-SI units (for example, a GPS sensor that is reporting numbers that represent feet instead of meters). This allows software to use the unit symbol information correctly convert and scale the raw data of those sources into SI-based units. The integer values are used for harmonization with IEC 61850.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Current in amperes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Amperes squared (A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A2h
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ampere-squared hour, ampere-squared hour.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A2s
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ampere squared time in square amperes (As).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: APerA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Current, ratio of amperages. Note: Users may need to supply a prefix such as m to show rates such as mA/A.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: APerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A/m, magnetic field strength, amperes per metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ah
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ampere-hours, ampere-hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: As
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ampere seconds (As).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Bq
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Radioactivity in becquerels (1/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Btu
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy, British Thermal Units.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: C
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric charge in coulombs (As).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CPerkg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Exposure (x rays), coulombs per kilogram.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CPerm2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Surface charge density, coulombs per square metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric charge density, coulombs per cubic metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: F
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric capacitance in farads (C/V).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: FPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Permittivity, farads per metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: G
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic flux density, gausses (1 G = 10-4 T).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Gy
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Absorbed dose in grays (J/kg).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: GyPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Absorbed dose rate, grays per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: H
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric inductance in henrys (Wb/A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: HPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Permeability, henrys per metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Hz
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Frequency in hertz (1/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: HzPerHz
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Frequency, rate of frequency change. Note: Users may need to supply a prefix such as m to show rates such as mHz/Hz.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: HzPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Rate of change of frequency in hertz per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: J
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy in joules (Nm = CV = Ws).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPerK
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Heat capacity in joules/kelvin.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPerkg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specific energy, Joules / kg.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPerkgK
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specific heat capacity, specific entropy, joules per kilogram Kelvin.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPerm2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Insulation energy density, joules per square metre or watt second per square metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy density, joules per cubic metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPermol
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Molar energy, joules per mole.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPermolK
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Molar entropy, molar heat capacity, joules per mole kelvin.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy rate in joules per second (J/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: K
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Temperature in kelvins.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: KPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Temperature change rate in kelvins per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: M
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Length, nautical miles (1 M = 1852 m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Mx
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic flux, maxwells (1 Mx = 10-8 Wb).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: N
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Force in newtons (kgm/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Surface tension, newton per metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Nm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Moment of force, newton metres.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Oe
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic field in oersteds, (1 Oe = (103/4p) A/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Pa
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pressure in pascals (N/m). Note: the absolute or relative measurement of pressure is implied with this entry. See below for more explicit forms.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PaPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pressure change rate in pascals per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Pas
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dynamic viscosity, pascal seconds.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Q
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Quantity power, Q.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Qh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Quantity energy, Qh.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: S
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Conductance in siemens.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Conductance per length (F/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sv
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dose equivalent in sieverts (J/kg).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: T
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic flux density in teslas (Wb/m2).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: V
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric potential in volts (W/A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: V2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volt squared (W/A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: V2h
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volt-squared hour, volt-squared-hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Apparent power in volt amperes. See also real power and reactive power.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VAh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Apparent energy in volt ampere hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VAr
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power in volt amperes reactive. The reactive or imaginary component of electrical power (VIsin(phi)). (See also real power and apparent power). Note: Different meter designs use different methods to arrive at their results. Some meters may compute reactive power as an arithmetic value, while others compute the value vectorially. The data consumer should determine the method in use and the suitability of the measurement for the intended purpose.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VArh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive energy in volt ampere reactive hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VPerHz
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic flux in volt per hertz.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VPerV
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Voltage, ratio of voltages. Note: Users may need to supply a prefix such as m to show rates such as mV/V.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VPerVA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power factor, PF, the ratio of the active power to the apparent power. Note: The sign convention used for power factor will differ between IEC meters and EEI (ANSI) meters. It is assumed that the data consumers understand the type of meter being used and agree on the sign convention in use at any given utility.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VPerVAr
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power factor, PF, the ratio of the active power to the apparent power. Note: The sign convention used for power factor will differ between IEC meters and EEI (ANSI) meters. It is assumed that the data consumers understand the type of meter being used and agree on the sign convention in use at any given utility.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric field strength, volts per metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Vh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volt-hour, Volt hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Vs
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volt seconds (Ws/A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: W
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Real power in watts (J/s). Electrical power may have real and reactive components. The real portion of electrical power (I²R or VIcos(phi)), is expressed in Watts. See also apparent power and reactive power.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPerA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power per current flow, watts per Ampere.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPerW
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Signal Strength, ratio of power. Note: Users may need to supply a prefix such as m to show rates such as mW/W.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPerm2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Heat flux density, irradiance, watts per square metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPerm2sr
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Radiance, watts per square metre steradian.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPermK
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Thermal conductivity in watt/metres kelvin.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ramp rate in watts per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPersr
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Radiant intensity, watts per steradian.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Wb
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic flux in webers (Vs).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Wh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Real energy in watt hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: anglemin
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Plane angle, minutes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: anglesec
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Plane angle, seconds.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: bar
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pressure in bars, (1 bar = 100 kPa).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: cd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Luminous intensity in candelas.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: charPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Data rate (baud) in characters per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: character
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Number of characters.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: cosPhi
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power factor, dimensionless. Note 1: This definition of power factor only holds for balanced systems. See the alternative definition under code 153. Note 2: Beware of differing sign conventions in use between the IEC and EEI. It is assumed that the data consumer understands the type of meter in use and the sign convention in use by the utility.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: count
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Amount of substance, Counter value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: d
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time in days, day = 24 h = 86400 s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dB
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sound pressure level in decibels. Note: multiplier d is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dBm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power level (logarithmic ratio of signal strength , Bel-mW), normalized to 1mW. Note: multiplier d is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: deg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Plane angle in degrees.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: degC
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Relative temperature in degrees Celsius. In the SI unit system the symbol is C. Electric charge is measured in coulomb that has the unit symbol C. To distinguish degree Celsius from coulomb the symbol used in the UML is degC. The reason for not using C is that the special character is difficult to manage in software.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ft3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume, cubic feet.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: gPerg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration, The ratio of the mass of a solute divided by the mass of the solution. Note: Users may need use a prefix such a to express a quantity such as g/g.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: gal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume in gallons, US gallon (1 gal = 231 in3 = 128 fl ounce).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: h
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time in hours, hour = 60 min = 3600 s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ha
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Area, hectares.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kat
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Catalytic activity, katal = mol / s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: katPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Catalytic activity concentration, katals per cubic metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mass in kilograms. Note: multiplier k is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kgPerJ
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Weight per energy in kilograms per joule (kg/J). Note: multiplier k is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kgPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Density in kilogram/cubic metres (kg/m). Note: multiplier k is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kgm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Moment of mass in kilogram metres (kgm) (first moment of mass). Note: multiplier k is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kgm2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Moment of mass in kilogram square metres (kgm) (Second moment of mass, commonly called the moment of inertia). Note: multiplier k is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kn
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Speed, knots (1 kn = 1852/3600) m/s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: l
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume in litres, litre = dm3 = m3/1000.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lPerh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volumetric flow rate, litres per hour.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lPerl
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration, The ratio of the volume of a solute divided by the volume of the solution. Note: Users may need use a prefix such a to express a quantity such as L/L.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volumetric flow rate in litres per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Luminous flux in lumens (cdsr).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lx
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Illuminance in lux (lm/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Length in metres.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Area in square metres (m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m2Pers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Viscosity in square metres / second (m/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume in cubic metres (m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3Compensated
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume, cubic metres, with the value compensated for weather effects.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3Perh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volumetric flow rate, cubic metres per hour.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3Perkg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specific volume, cubic metres per kilogram, v.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3Pers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volumetric flow rate in cubic metres per second (m/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3Uncompensated
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume, cubic metres, with the value uncompensated for weather effects.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Fuel efficiency in metres per cubic metres (m/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Velocity in metres per second (m/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mPers2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Acceleration in metres per second squared (m/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: min
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time in minutes, minute = 60 s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mmHg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pressure, millimetres of mercury (1 mmHg is approximately 133.3 Pa).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mol
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Amount of substance in moles.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: molPerkg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration, Molality, the amount of solute in moles and the amount of solvent in kilograms.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: molPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration, The amount of substance concentration, (c), the amount of solvent in moles divided by the volume of solution in m.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: molPermol
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration, Molar fraction, the ratio of the molar amount of a solute divided by the molar amount of the solution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: none
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dimension less quantity, e.g. count, per unit, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ohm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric resistance in ohms (V/A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ohmPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric resistance per length in ohms per metre ((V/A)/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ohmm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Resistivity, ohm metres, (rho).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: onePerHz
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reciprocal of frequency (1/Hz).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: onePerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Wavenumber, reciprocal metres, (1/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ppm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration in parts per million.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rad
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Plane angle in radians (m/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: radPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Angular velocity in radians per second (rad/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: radPers2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Angular acceleration, radians per second squared.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rev
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Amount of rotation, revolutions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rotPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Rotations per second (1/s). See also Hz (1/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: s
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time in seconds.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time, Ratio of time. Note: Users may need to supply a prefix such as µ to show rates such as µs/s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sr
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Solid angle in steradians (m2/m2).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: therm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy, therms.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: tonne
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mass in tons, tonne or metric ton (1000 kg = 1 Mg).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Voltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electrical voltage, can be both AC and DC.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VoltageLevel
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A collection of equipment at one common system voltage forming a switchgear. The equipment typically consists of breakers, busbars, instrumentation, control, regulation and protection devices as well as assemblies of all these.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BaseVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The base voltage used for all equipment within the voltage level.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Bays
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The bays within this voltage level.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Substation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The substation of the voltage level.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: highVoltageLimit
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The bus bar's high voltage limit. The limit applies to all equipment and nodes contained in a given VoltageLevel. It is not required that it is exchanged in pair with lowVoltageLimit. It is preferable to use operational VoltageLimit, which prevails, if present.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lowVoltageLimit
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The bus bar's low voltage limit. The limit applies to all equipment and nodes contained in a given VoltageLevel. It is not required that it is exchanged in pair with highVoltageLimit. It is preferable to use operational VoltageLimit, which prevails, if present.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConnectivityNodes
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Connectivity nodes which belong to this connectivity node container.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Base
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Content of the base CIM published as IEC 61970-301.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Wires
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An extension to the Core and Topology package that models information on the electrical characteristics of Transmission and Distribution networks. This package is used by network applications such as State Estimation, Load Flow and Optimal Power Flow.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Topology
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An extension to the Core Package that, in association with the Terminal class, models Connectivity, that is the physical definition of how equipment is connected together. In addition it models Topology, that is the logical definition of how equipment is connected via closed switches. The Topology definition is independent of the other electrical characteristics.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: IEC61970
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Top package for IEC 61970.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Core
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contains the core PowerSystemResource and ConductingEquipment entities shared by all applications plus common collections of those entities. Not all applications require all the Core entities. This package does not depend on any other package except the Domain package, but most of the other packages have associations and generalizations that depend on it.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TC57CIM
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Top package for IEC TC57 CIM.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: LoadModel
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
This package is responsible for modelling the energy consumers and the system load as curves and associated curve data. Special circumstances that may affect the load, such as seasons and day types, are also included here.
This information is used by Load Forecasting and Load Management.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Domain
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The domain package defines primitive datatypes that are used by classes in other packages. Stereotypes are used to describe the datatypes. The following stereotypes are defined: <<enumeration>> A list of permissible constant values. <<Primitive>> The most basic data types used to compose all other data types. <<CIMDatatype>> A datatype that contains a value attribute, an optional unit of measure and a unit multiplier. The unit and multiplier may be specified as a static variable initialized to the allowed value. <<Compound>> A composite of Primitive, enumeration, CIMDatatype or other Compound classes, as long as the Compound classes do not recurse. For all datatypes both positive and negative values are allowed unless stated otherwise for a particular datatype.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equivalents
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The equivalents package models equivalent networks.
